Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible, terrible...”
Reviews.Author: Tuculatte
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, dirty linen, dirty, mouldy bathroom...and we had the better balcony room (with a broken balcony chair)! The worst stay we had in Sydney. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i have stayed at in my life”
Reviews.Author: Al S
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. There was rubbish in the room, blood on the sheets, a contruction yard floodlight for a light, an un usable bathroom, mould everywhere you looked, no windows, no air conditioning God forbid there was ever a fire in that building, there is no emergency exit. Disregard any review that gives this more than 1 star. If you stay here you WILL regret it for the rest of your life

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: CestLeVie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 'balcony room' at this hotel on Wotif. When we arrived we had to look for the "reception" staff, but didn't have to wait for long as they were servicing a room and noticed us waiting. There are no lifts at this hotel, and we had to walk up 3 flights of stairs to get to our room, on the top floor. We both thought that the images online of this hotel were a little out of date, as our room was not as crisp as the photos looked. Some quick fixes have obviously been made over time and it shows. Our room (302) was quite large, and our bathroom was a good size. We found that the room was surprisingly quiet of a nighttime even though the nightclub downstairs was open and the hotel is located on a major road which was really busy. The curtains made the room dark for the morning. The location of the hotel is supreme if you are interested in heading out for dinner, a few drinks or seeing the nightlife (abiet the nightlife is pretty trashy - but great for people watching). The price they are asking is a little inflated, but if you could get a deal for around $120-$150 (balcony room) it's probably on the mark for an inner city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking...”
Reviews.Author: Rocah
Reviews.Content: I arrived here on a Saturday night - it was in a location where I felt very unnerved and unsafe, because this hotel is located on the boundary of Kings Cross and Darlinghurst. The reception was not attended and it took a long time for someone to come out and take us up to our room. The staff's English was not very good. There were no lifts so we had to go up three flights of stairs on foot with our luggage. We got into the room - the room was way darker than in the photos - I did not feel safe. The carpet was old, the bathroom did not have sufficient lighting, and the shower was close to dark. The soaps were tiny and there was not much other toiletries. The wash basin was very small. The balcony outside the room was dirty, and it had a massive glass table broken in half - not a good look. The price wasn't cheap for the quality either. I would not ever go back and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “charged $100 for cancelling!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah1788
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before reading the reviews as most places were booked out and we'd left it quite late to find somewhere for 9 people this weekend. However, after reading the reviews we decided to keep looking and find somewhere else and now are staying at a backpackers. Although it clearly says on their webpage you can cancel with no charge up to 72hours beforehand they still insisted on charging us $100 even though we're cancelling 4 days in advance! This place is definitely dodgy. Thanks for the warnings!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and run down but great staff”
Reviews.Author: huxxie
Reviews.Content: This is easily the worst hotel I've stayed in Sydney for the price. Tatty carpet and poorly fitted out room. It should be advertised as a cheap hostel. Wanted to leave as soon as I arrived. However the staff were very polite and helpful which eased the pain.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Hell”
Reviews.Author: Aml69
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights here. Worst place I've ever stayed in. Website photos were clearly taken over 5 years ago when first renovated. Rooms are now dirty, all walls marked, yellowing, with holes. Maintenance is none existent as half the light bulbs were blown. Despite no smoking rules they were clearly smoking in the rooms, it stank. On the ground floor was a bar come nightclub that played the loudest music, shaking my room 2 floors above until at least 3am. I.e got very little sleep. Bathroom was filthy. Room was not serviced. Toiletries were none existent. Wish I had read reviews before.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: melb3000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting, Building interior is dull and stunk of smoke. Room was FILTHY dirty. Bedding and pillows had not been washed and you could see stains and hair from previous guests still in the bed. Bathroom was mouldy. Noisy !! Hotel is next to a nightclub. The music and people were so loud, It was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place.. Please do NOT book”
Reviews.Author: whitecheetah80
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Sydney and I regretted that I spent money to book 3 nights in a disgusting hotel and my mom had to suffer that with me. All the pics on Wotif were wrong and misleading.. there is no such boutique hotel but a ugly super old pig hole. The hotel is small. The reception is just a tiny alley. The room is old and disgusting. The tower is so so old as well. The Asian guy who is the owner was so unhelpful and unfriendly. There is a bar next door and on Saturday night, the music was so so loud that even my room was on 2nd floor, I still felt the wall was shaking like in an earthquake. My mom and I couldn't sleep till 2am then had to call the police. Luckily music stopped after 4mins. I would never step back to that place anymore. Even I'm from a much poorer country, the no-star hotels in my country are much much better than it.

Reviews.Title: “What a con and disgrace to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Couplan-Jones
Reviews.Content: This is truely the worst hotel I have ever seen, No bar No restaurant. (faulse advertising) I have stayed in hotels all over the world and Australia and this place is nothing other than filthy. The bathroom OMG. Anyway, you get the picture. I stayed 15min. Don't book !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst place I've stayed ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Suslu1976
Reviews.Content: I believe that positive opinions about this place can be added only by the owner of l'otel. There is no posibility that someone could possibly like staying at this place!!! It was dirty and disgusting. Fangus in bathroom. Dirty sheets-we had to ask the receptionist to change it. When he saw it, he took us to another "bigger" room. The "bigger" room was 0,5m2 bigger from the first one. Walls looked like painted by drunk person. Air conditioning was working just in one hour mode: after one hour it was turning off. There was no window, which we could open to breathe... This place should be shut!

Reviews.Title: “Hookers, drugs and pimps. This hotel books by the hour. DO NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DorisfromAuckland
Reviews.Content: Before I went a friend passed comment about staying at L'Otel. She said that it was where the drug dealers hang out and the rooms are rented by the hour. When we arrived the asian guy that owns it was so rude and lead us down the road and across a carpark where our bags would not roll. He was too fat to carry the bags and threw the key at us and told us the room was at the top of the stairs. The photos are misleading they were taken years ago in fact the paint was peeling off with dirt and marks on the wall. I would be happy to take this guy to the cleaners for misleading advertising. He was rude and clearly could get the room rented by the hour after we left for a better hotel. The people at Quest in Potts point are lovely and the hotel is great. It is not much more in terms of cost.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, overpriced, terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Elyce2988
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I looked up a few places to stay and this one came across on wotif.com as modern, simple and affordable, although once we arrived I wish we had read the reviews because it was quite the opposite. Walking in the " reception" if that's what you would call a tiny foyer with a desk and barely enough room to fit our luggage through, the walls were bashed and dirty, the smell of vomit and urine was enough to make you sick on the way to the room, once we got in it wasn't much different, the sheets were stained, the walls filthy, the tv had one channel working, the remote didn't work, the bathroom was filthy and needed a refurbishment, a random floodlight coming out of the wall meant to be " arty" looked dodgy. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Website”
Reviews.Author: markio
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago and it was really run-down then, so god knows what it's like now! The room we stayed in looked as though it had had some attempt at interior design - but with a naff, half-hearted school project feel to it. Everything was white which only served to highlight how dirty everything was, bathroom extremely cramped and badly designed, strange floodlights in the room illuminating the dirty ceilings and it was freezing cold... should I go on?! More like a backpackers than a hotel, our room rate included a bottle of wine and chocolates - the wine never materialised and the chocolates (three of them) were presented to us in a kleenex tissue! On reflection, I'm sat here laughing at how bad it was... at the time, I wasn't a happy chappy!

Reviews.Title: “below third world quality service & value”
Reviews.Author: onetoomanytrips
Reviews.Content: I knew this place was nothing special, I actually booked the reservation in person a few weeks prior but nothing could prepare you for simply the biggest rip off you could ever experience. I travel a lot, i've stayed in many hotels on many different budgets but this place is something of an abomination. There is nothing positive to say about this property, just think of any question or quiery you could have and assume the worst. Under no circumstances should anyone stay at this property!

Reviews.Title: “The terrible reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: amylou91
Reviews.Content: We didn't read reviews until after we had booked, but we approached our stay with trepidation, hoping that the previous negative reviews were mistaken. They weren't. The website is very misleading. This is no boutique hotel...The only word to describe the reception and foyer is 'dingy'. The rooms are slightly better. We stayed in a standard room which was clean and had a comfortable bed, but had frosted over windows and felt claustrophobic. The TV still has a VCR attached. The bathroom flooded and the toilet wasn't properly cleaned. The website also fails to mention that there's a nightclub directly below the hotel that plays throbbing music that is clearly audible in the hotel rooms into the early hours of the morning. We didn't sleep a wink until 3am when they closed. I would only recommend this hotel if you're having a huge night out in Kings Cross and plan on passing out the minute you get back to your room. It's worth paying extra to stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot express How BAD this place is! BE WARNED”
Reviews.Author: Douggy69
Reviews.Content: It sounded wonderful on the Wotif website and the rooms looked quite nicely finished BUT it was a different matter when I checked in. It felt like I was checking into a back packers, with some school kid checking me in and bags of rubbish and used linen piled around the hole in the wall that was the reception desk. I was tempted to run then, but the location was convenient and the room was already paid for. Expecting to be directed up the stairs to the room that was illustrated, I picked up my bag to follow the guy to my room, but he walks out the front door and goes into the dodgiest looking building where no lights worked and the stair cases were the narrowest I have seen outside Europe. I was handed my key and the kid disappeared. Filthy, disgusting, dusty, musty windowless hole is the only way to describe this room. The air conditioning sort of worked and the bathroon was unclean and moldy. A cup of tea would have been nice, excpet there was nowhere to plug the kettle in, except if it was sat on the floor to boil. SO I went back to the desk to ask for another room, but the kid had disappeared and after waiting 15 mins for someone to materialise, I was told that it was the best room in the category I booked and I could pay a $50 supplement to upgrade but he was staying in that room and it would have to be serviced and I would have a two hour wait. I declined the offer and decided to leave. Never ever again. It says "boutique style" accommodation on Wotif, but I am puzzled how that translates to dirty, dingy and dodgy. I am sure a call to NSW Health would have this place closed in a flash. Lucky I was able to find a pub room nearby that was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: BusybeeSydney
Reviews.Content: My 5th stay so far and I have never been disappointed! David downstairs is doing a great job keeping the place up and running. Any probs, speak to him first, he will always be happy to help! The larger rooms are lovely and peaceful with heavenly beds and fantastic showers. Don't expect 5 stars if paying for 2, but enjoy where you are for such good value for your money. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: funtraveller999
Reviews.Content: This hotel use to be funky - it had a great decor but now has been run down. There are so many examples of this - doors cracked and dirty, walls unclean, a mouldy bathroom tiles and so on. My room had no windows you could open and there was a stench of dampness in the air. The bathroom did not have proper air vents, so the steam goes no where. It just felt dirty and yucky. Please do not stay here. A good backpackers would be better and cheaper that this. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BOTHER - WHAT A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: ipswichianQld
Reviews.Content: Supposed to be a boutique hotel, what a joke! Dingy little room that smelt of cigarette smoke.Shower curtain too short so bathroom flooded. Only 1 small piece of soap to last 2 people 2 days-not even a piece each for basin and shower. Remote controls for TV and A/C didn't work(flat batteries). No clock radio in room either. We weren't even put up in main hotel but some dodgy building at the back. Not what we were led to believe by website.Place is a fire trap. Wouldn't recommend it to even the most money conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Majorly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Shereep
Reviews.Content: I'm at L'otel tonight, I've never seen a room this small. The walls haven't been painted for years, only a thin sheet on the bed, the room smells and I have a beautiful view of piles of rubbish. Wish we had read reviews first. It is nothing like the website!! On a positive excellent location and ok if ur just spending a few hours after a night out. If I were the managers I would be embarrassed to charge 150 a night

Reviews.Title: “I felt sick the moment I saw the place.”
Reviews.Author: Snowflock
Reviews.Content: I always look up the review but this time we were in a hurry and booked it on the internet. It does NOT look like the photos on there website. There is NO window! The showercurtain is too short. The socket for electricity was so low, we had to boil water on the floor. The cheap carpet was terrible. The "thing" between the sheets was so dirty, it had all kinds of stains on it. We booked another hotel nearby and that was very good (same price range) My husband said to me, we can write about this when we come back home, so this is my very first rewiew of a hotel in my life. I truely hope that this building doesn't catch fire because if you are in it, you'll be trapped because there is no way out!

Reviews.Title: “L'Otel - What a hell hole!”
Reviews.Author: Here2Help20
Reviews.Content: Quite honestly the most disgusting place I've been to. So bad we didn't even stay the night. Hope your reading these reviews before your thinking about booking, if you have already booked try and get a refund, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “NOT As Seen On Web”
Reviews.Author: MatRasul
Reviews.Content: I had high expectation before i check-in since they called themselves boutique accomodation but upon my arrival the room wasn't propelly look after. Sand on my carpet indicating it hasn't been vacuum. Mold in the toilet, its everywear. Seriously disgusting. I made a mistake during booking. Normally i read the review first but in this case i was to grab a deal from lastminute.com.au and forgotten about the hotel review. Its a hard mistake to be learnt.

Reviews.Title: “L'otel - It's what you make it.....”
Reviews.Author: zazooACT
Reviews.Content: I've read all the bad reviews and - by and large - agree. The only reason to stay here is for the location. If you must stay here then book one of the balcony rooms - the ability to have fresh air and natural light is essential. No other room is worth the money - no matter how cheap. Everything about the hotel is worn and dirty. It's such a shame because at one stage it clearly would've been considered "tres-chic" and "uber-funky". I'd say considerable expense was invested about 10 to 15 years ago to rennovate this place but sadly virtually nothing has been spent in a long time. I suspect the hotel has changed hands, I think it was part of the 'Eight Hotels' group but no longer, and the new owners are either out of their depth, don't care, or both. We had fun during our stay - the fact we had adjoining balcony rooms overlooking the street made it. It was not expensive overall and we made fun of the almost 'faulty towers' like service. Having said that, if you stayed here based on what their website and most hotel booking websites say then I'd be pissed!

Reviews.Title: “LOW'TEL, sad sad sad”
Reviews.Author: RupertBirkin
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to pile on to this Lotel-bashing string of reviews but apparently the only satisfaction I'm going to reap from my own unique Lotel experience is composing this ode to quite possibly the most dismal, depressing, heart-breakingly dreary hotel in Sydney. First off, I am not a fussy traveller, nor am I put off by the usual urban hum and color one expects in the Darlinghurst fun-zone (and my favorite cafe Petit Creme is right next-door) but please spare me the nearly litigious website descriptions of the property. "Luxury, designer.. " Really? I guess minimalist interior design has now given forth to nihilist design. Four stark white walls, a bed and one straight back chair in the corner. Australian moderne? I can dig it , but why even bother with the extravagance of a chair? Oh yeah, "luxury". "Hip, ambient, intimate". Wow. If only those euphemisms could fumigate that windowless cell. I would guess the first floor rooms (like mine) were largely rented by the hour since I can't imagine much sleeping gets done (on the weekend anyway) given the "ambient intimacy" of the Reggaeton slicing through the paper thin walls from the club on the opposite side from Petit Cremer. It sounded like fun, more than what was happening in " my hotel room at the end of the world" where I lay wondering how effective I was going to be at work the next day. But hey, I could have asked to be moved to another unsoundproofed room. The phone didn't work. Air-conditioner inoperative. The bathroom double-doors were sadly unaligned so could not close. The shower looked grotty and unscrubbed. Each day, small bags of trash were left decorating the hallway (more minimalist design no doubt). Cable reception for that hanging tv monitor (see AliBe103's fotos) that looked like it was salvaged from the Mir space station was spotty at best. To sum up, this is the room one checks into to die anonymously, forgotten, forlorn, alone. The desk clerk was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Prostitutes, drug dealers, robbers in L'Otel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hhh09
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel i stayed!! I rather you sleep on the streets or at the airport!!! Dirty, doggy! Lots of criminals and working girls in and out of the hotel. Noisy unsafe environment! Conversations can be heard very cleary through the doors. Lots of drug dealings and illegal activities going on in this Lotel! The pics from this hotel site are not acurate at all! L'otel should not be called a boutique hotel is seems more like a brothel to me. All the bad reviews given by the reviewers are all true! Hotel management staff are extremely rude! My advice is do not stay in this "criminal" hotel! There are much more better boutiques hotel across the road. Same rate as this Lotel but better. And safer! And worst heard from other hotels management that there's few incidents where guests' luggage or personal items were stole in this L'otel!!! BE WARNED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal - but very bad service....”
Reviews.Author: YakkaAustralia
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews of this hotel - and I think that they are all correct.. - I booked a room at L'Otel through Wotif website... - the rate was good for Kings Cross and the hotel is central. Would I stay there again, well I am not sure...! The check in area is small and cramped and a bit of a mess. The young guy on duty when I arrived was in a bit of a muddle but willingly carried my bag to the room, which was nice. The hotel is showing signs of considerable wear and the main carpets well worn - the accommodation was fine but the room did smell of smoke and there was no window to the room just a pain of fostered glass. Air Con. was good. Phone did not work (you have to advise the receptionist if you wish to make a call or talk to reception â€“ well they are not there at night anyway. The room size was ok and (I booked a bigger room on the net) and the linen clean and the bed comfortable - bathroom was small but ok and the room (it was an internal room) was quiet. Service was basically non - existent and there was no one there at 8.00am when I wanted to check out... I came back about 10.30 to and asked if I could leave my small bag until 2.00 pm and was told there was a $10.00 service charge after 12.00 pm - a bit rich I thought for 2 hours... - I paid the money and saw the $ 10.00 disappear into the receptionists wallet and no receipt was given - so the holding of baggage is a nice little money earner for the staff I would think. All in all, the hotel served it's purpose for me - I was invited to dinner close by and it was convenient for this - but would I stay again, well I am not sure, but certainally not if something better came along - the experience was depressing due to lack of care and service by the staff. Lâ€™Otel is certainally not a boutique hotel as advertised. It is very tired and perhaps itâ€™s rates reflect thisâ€¦. So be warned and not dissapoointed Mike - Australia.

Reviews.Title: “I should've picked up on 'VCR' in room..”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi4trav
Reviews.Content: I could not believe how opposite and misleading the website was to the reality of this place. The pictures on the website make this place decent where as in reality: - the room was dirty with the carpet peeling - the lightbox was missing, the shower curtain was too short so it flooded the bathroom after each use - the place seemed to have long stay people next to us who smoked a lot so it creeped into our room at all times. - The power plug in the room was on the floor next to the exit door so the jug needed to boiled on the floor so didn't bother. - Customer service was terrible as I was leaving at 8am but no one was at reception. After calling several times the number at the door and buzzing the alarm several times as well, no one came so I ended up going back to the room and leaving the key in the room. - Last of all to top it off to put everyone off and I'm sure it will....Credit card details were not locked away!!!!!!! I was going to leave the hotel room card in the draw in the unoccupied reception area so opened a draw and found everyone hotel details that were photocopied once you arrive. That's why I left the hotel room card in the hotel room with a note. I hope to get photo that I had taken up soon. This L'OTEL accommodation base sadly gives Sydney a bad name. It should be closed down for repairs at least or have some new owners. Once thing I could give this place was its location. Central to everything. So if you looking for a quick place to shag a bird from Kings Cross or a place to shoot your drugs, come to L'otel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: australiaandoverseas
Reviews.Content: Unless you like finding syringes under your bed, I suggest that you stay at another hotel. I think that the top level of this hotel must have bigger or nicer rooms. But if you pay for a standard or queen room, watch out! The rooms ARE NOT as advertised! I was taken to a tiny, windowless room. The bathroom was a tiny wedge--when you sit on the toilet, your knees hit the wall (I'm five foot one!!) The really mouldy bathroom floods every time you have a shower. The room itself is noisy until about 4am because there is a nightclub next door (this wasn't mentioned at the time of booking). Apart from this, management appeared to "live" in the room next door to us. Every time we walked past, management had a gas stove on in a tiny room, cooking smelly curries and smoking to the point that the horrendous smell wafted into our room. Last time I checked, smoking indoors is illegal in Australia. But the last straw was on the last night, my partner and I found a bag of syringes under the bed. Clearly the room had not been cleaned since the last person had stayed. Believe me, you can find better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel room in the city . ..”
Reviews.Author: Drake181
Reviews.Content: We (as many others have) expected a decent room, nothing too flash for the price. When we checked in: 1. There was no parking. Ok can deal with that. 2. Room was tiny. Near windowless it was a wedge shaped little thing with a tiny bathroom. 3. Room was not as described. We paid for a Queen size bed in the room . It was a double. . . i don't fit in a double. 4. Hotel was dingy and dirty. like the rest of the cross, this hotel could be described as the all dirty back streets of the cross shoved into one hotel. We bought this room on Wotif, due to the fact we paid for it L'otel refused to give us a refund for the room which was not as described, so we stayed at another hotel for the night. I really suggest that anyone who thinks of staying here, reconsiders. In my experience it is very poor value for money, you are paying for a location not for a room. Oh and the management (in our experience) are a bunch of Liars.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully surprised”
Reviews.Author: lee47oz
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel before I read the reveiws- i then read these tripadvisor reviews and thus approached my stay with trepidation. I was thankfully surprised. I had a great room- the one that is inthe pics on the website- a balcony room- adequate size for a lone traveller or for a couple.. Staff were always friendly- though i was not a demanding guest- Location is brilliant- I travelled the North Coast for a few days and was happy to then book the hotel again (same room at the same price) the following weekend. I suspect some of the other rooms are not as good- but I can only go on my experience. If it is possible to specify a balcony room then I think you will be satisfied unkless you are particularly fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: meljoy77
Reviews.Content: From the very second we walked into this place, we wanted to leave. Unfortunately, our budget wouldn't allow it. Parking was the first issue - the guy at reception seemed confused when we asked where we could leave our car during our 3 day stay, but eventually suggested the hospital several blocks away. The room itself was windowless and filthy. The bathroom had no ventilation fan which is probably why the shower curtain was so mouldy. There was nowhere to hang our towels. The doona had no cover on it, so we could see the gross bloodstain on it. Not as gross as the bloodstain smeared on the wall! We could not get the heater to work and we did not want to get under the filthy doona for warmth so we were cold most of the time. There were spare pillows, but they had no pillowcase. There was a general thick layer of dust on most surfaces. I will never ever go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here At Your Peril!”
Reviews.Author: RudiMikiRufus
Reviews.Content: Well, where do you start with such a horrendous hotel experience? It is 3:06 AM, we are in bed unable to sleep for the third night in a row due to the music BLASTING from the adjoining nightclubs (they don't tell you about that on the website) We have moved rooms 3 times, always with the same promise that it won't happen again, it does, night after night. If the carnival below weren't bad enough then the general state of disprepair and non maintenance throught the building is......dirty white walls, worn carpet, bad design, the constant aroma of damp mildew from the poorly designed showers that leak/flood the bathroom every time you use them. The rooms are small and cramped. DVD players have not reached L'otel yet, still tv's with fuzzy reception (of maybe 4 channels??) and a VIDEO RECORDER!!! (probably Betamax). The feather pillows are nice though and the inventiveness of the staff when it comes to finding excuses/proffering assurance that 'it wont happen again' has to be marveled at. If it wasn't for the luggage we have, we would probably do better bedding down on a local park bench. L'Otel?? more like N'Otel. NEVER STAY HERE, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: Magnitude69
Reviews.Content: This hotel rates with the worst I have ever stayed in. Rooms were dirty and smelt of damp. Rooms looked nothing like on the webb site. Stay away from this place a bus shelter would be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the Website”
Reviews.Author: Economy_Class_Clive
Reviews.Content: Beware, if this hotel ever looked like it does on it's website it was a very long time ago. We saw a review in the Lonely Planet guide that led us to the somewhat misleading website As has been stated in other reviews, the rooms are very small, some have opaque windows that do not open. The stairs are very narrow, there is no lift, the stair carpet is threadbare in places and there are often laundry bags left on the stairs. All of which makes it very difficult to get heavy suit cases up to the rooms. The duvets (doonas) are not very clean, they don't have proper covers, but are just wrapped in sheets Our room looked clean clean, but we did have a cock roach in with us one night. There was a very loud fan running very late into the night, presumably from the restaurant next door and music can be heard thumping until the early hours too. The only redeeming features were a great shower and the location. It is less than a five minute walk to King's Cross station and a 20 minute walk into the CBD. I can't recommend L'otel at all and I am sure there are much better places to stay in Sydney for the prices charged.

Reviews.Title: “Very misleading advertising!”
Reviews.Author: Trevaaar
Reviews.Content: While the staff were very friendly and accomodating and upgraded us to a larger room, I too was very disappointed to find the advertising for L'otel was misleading to say the least-for 'Boutique' you should read 'extremely small'.The creative photographs on this page make you think you are booking a large light and airy room, when it is nothing like that.The bedding was-as promised-very nice, with crisp white linen and lovely towels, but there was rubbish underneath the bed and the baby cockroach in the shower was also a bit yuck. Also, one of their websites says the hotel is about a $20-$25 taxi fare from the airport, when in fact it was over $40. The location was brilliant for access to public transport and also the funky eateries in the surrounding streets but-and this is a BIG but, the hotel site fails to mention the NIGHTCLUB directly underneath where the rooms are, with loud music thumping till about 3am.I would be willing to forgive a smaller room, and even a bit of poor cleaning, because we were not in Sydney to see the hotel room, but the fact that I was prevented from sleeping because of the noise was a major turn-off. I thought it'd be nice staying in a smaller boutique-style place as opposed to the larger hotels but don't believe this place offers good value for money and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful hotel - stay away”
Reviews.Author: AliBe1803
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I missed the reviews here before I booked this truly awful hotel. Their website is a total mis-representation; the hotel is dirty, rooms are ridiculously small, amenties are not as represented, windows have opaque glass as there is a wall immediately outside. The only positive thing I can say about it is the showers are good! Our 4 nights here (pre-paid of course) were the only low points of an otherwise exceptional 4 week holiday. Do not stay at L'Otel - you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd read these reviews first...”
Reviews.Author: myscreennamesux
Reviews.Content: Everything that has been written is true, this place is truly terrible... We booked after seeing the incredibly misleading website, thinking it looked fantastic. In reality, this place is a dump and we contemplated leaving as soon as we got there. After finding the entrance to be a non descript door (reminded me of visiting a brothel) and checking in in a narrow corridor at the base of the staircase, we were dubious about the quality of the hotel. We went up the narrow, creaking, dirty carpeted staircase too the 'grand' room that we had booked to find a small filthy box with no windows, a small bed with once white linen and a bathroom so small that you couldn't sit on the toilet without hitting your head on the wall as you sat down. The only other furniture in the room was a hard white chair and a tv mounted to the wall near the roof. The place had barely been cleaned, and the bathroom was so filthy we didn't want to use it. The electronic keys to the room didn't work more often than they did work, and at 3am when i tried the key to the front entrance i found myself locked out. No matter how long i buzzed for, no-one came to let me in. The only good thing i can say for this place was that it was in a convenient location for us for the night, however, its definately worth spending an extra $20 to stay in a much nicer place nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: littleozzietraveller
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed with our stay at this hotel. As other travellers have mentioned, the photos on the website are very misleading! Our bathroom looked nothing like the one in the picture, with a shower full of mould. The doona and shower curtain were both filthy, looking like neither had been cleaned properly in a long time. Our room also lacked a balcony (as requested). The only window in the room was painted white with no possible way to see out or open it for some much needed fresh air into the room. The only positive is the location. The hotel is within walking distance to central Sydney or with easy access to public transport. There are many good restaurants and shops in surrounding streets. Overall though, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Budget traveller paradise with glitches to swallow !”
Reviews.Author: Thirupukuzhi
Reviews.Content: Budget traveller paradise........................but a nightmare for an upscale traveller with a family. The Website pictures are misleading.The interiors and the Hotel looks far from what you see in Web.There are no elevators, if you have heavy baggage it is a nightmare climbing the narrow stairs. Nodoubt for that price, the location and the surroundings and amenities available around are amazing. If you are an Asian, you have Malabar(Indian) Restuarant in Victoria street(back of the Hotel),A Thai takeaway in front of the Hotel.The next door is pure vegetarian ISCON spiritual center anf food is available. Bus 311 takes you to Central Quay. A few meters walk you are in Kingscross station. The room I stayed for a week supposedly a big one, but no windows, you are shut off from external world, but who cares, as a tourist you are not going to spend the whole day in the room.YOu have come to see Sydney! Darlinghurst is a great area, for the price that I paid I can not complain, may be I am a compromising person. The Reception desk attendants were friendly and helpful. I would not condemn it, but would certainly recommend for a budget traveller with lots of facilities in the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Not Chic....”
Reviews.Author: Lemoya
Reviews.Content: I was overjoyed by the website for the this hotel and truly expecting a "luxury designer hotel" as indicated on their website link. While the stay wasn't necessarily a horific stay, it was memorable for both good and bad reasons. The hotel in and of itself was a bit dated. My boyfriend was abhorred by the fact that they did not include duvet covers on the once-white but nearly off-white duvet. And I really got a kick out of our champagne and chocolate turn down service which was a bigger turn-off when the, albeit friendly, staff member, knocked on the door and shoved three halloween sized mars bars in my hand and handed me a bottle of sparkling wine. Located in Darlinghurst it was able to suit our needs, yet one should be warned that it sits close to the entrance of Kings Cross (a plus or negative depending on ones tastes). The Balconies, which are easily shared by the neighboring room, were a plus, however, I would never stay here with anything but an open mind and a major discount from the rates that they charge on the website (Executive rooms with balcony from AU$275.00 ) and a preparation the enjoy the beautiful, exciting, city of Sydney. While the website claims that "no expense has been spared on this Burley Katon Halliday refurbishment" go in knowing that little expense has been applied to the maintenance of the hotel. Lemoya

Reviews.Title: “shabby - not chic!”
Reviews.Author: aloriemichelle
Reviews.Content: This place was a major disappointment. This hotel looks like it was chic at one time but has been neglected in a big way. The place is dirty and the reception area is a strange little hallway. When we complained about the shabbiness of our room they put us in another room that was not much better and lacked a balcony, which we had reserved. But they still charged us the balcony room rate! We argued with them and things got very tense. Overall, a terrible experience! The only thing good about this place is its location - it's in a great neighborhood full of fun bars, shops and restaurants. If you want this location, the Kirketon, which is just down the street looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely appalling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've never seen a hotel as filthy as this. We booked via the internet after seeing the appealing - but completely mis-leading website. After checking in we were given vague directions out and around the corner to the second part of the hotel. After climbing the narrow, stained carpet stairs we arrived at our room which smelt like an ashtray. The walls and furniture was filthy with sticky Coca Cola stains all over the chair. The bathroom smelt like mould (coming from the rotten shower curtain) and the toilet had not been cleaned. The only window opened onto the roof of the Thai restaurant next door (complete with noise and smells of an industrial kitchen fan). There was no cover on the quilt - just 2 sheets folded over it to look like a quilt cover, which upon getting into bed, fell apart to reveal the stained, cigarette smoke filled old doona. The final straw came in the morning when, kneeling on the floor to retreive some coins that had rolled under the bed, we came face to face with what I can only assume was months worth of rubbish and filth - including a used tampon. Needless to stay we checked out immediately and will never go back. The proprieters should be ashamed

Reviews.Title: “A real let down!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tibbs0675
Reviews.Content: A real anti-climax - A friend and I stayed here over Christmas and New Year (05/06). The room we were first put in resembled a dirty cell - when we complained and said unless we were able to have another room we would look to stay elsewhere - the owner took the offer of complimentary champagne on arrival from us. A little later he came to the room and apologised giving us the Champagne back and saying we could change rooms for the last 2 nights of our stay. The second room we moved into - still had no window so was very cell like. The paint work is very marked and dirty - was perhaps white about 5 years ago. The rooms aren't kept well, chips in glass work, crockery and missing from complimentary refreshment (along wioth evrything else you need to make a cup of tea or coffee!)- when I asked for milk I had to walk round the block to the reception (the hotel is split into two - and is accessed by 2 separate roads) I was handed a champagne flute with milk in - not quite sure what I felt like other than humilated having to walk throuhg the streets of Sydney back to my hotel room/cell with a flute of milk!! Very unprofessional wouldn't really recommend. It certainly needs a good spring clean and in desperate need of another lick of paint and clean carpets!! Grout in bathrooms are vile and they smell nasty - with other guests or the cleaners hair left as complimentary!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here- it's fine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in August 2005, I was going sailing with some Aussie friends around the Whitsunday Islands and decided to stay here for the 5 days I was in Sydney on my own, I'm a 27 year old women so I wanted somewhere I felt safe. I booked it through lastminute so I wasn't sure what to expect. I really couldn't fault the place, I was given one of the rooms on the top floor with a balcony, I'm not sure what the other rooms where like but I really liked mine. Bearing in mind I was staying here on my own I felt totally safe all the time, I liked the neighbourhood (OK Kings Cross is near by but you can avoid that)and I was often out when it was dark. Just keep your wits about you and you'll be fine. It is situated on a busy road so it is noisy, but this is a big city after all. It was cleaned everyday, with fresh towels and I thought the shower was great. The staff could be a bit cocky, but generally I found them very helpful, the only negative issues were the tea and coffee making facilities, the rubbish hair dryer and I couldn't work out the air con. Also, I arrived at 8am after a 23hour flight and they wouldn't let me have my room until 2pm but after badgering them they gave it to me sooner. You could easily walk into the city centre everyday, if you were up early enough you would catch the commuters so it felt like you were really part of the city. You can get the train into the centre from Kings Cross but it was really packed one morning when I caught it at 8am, if you walk you get a great view of the city and pass right through the Botanical Gardens which I thought were just beautiful. I liked the hotel that much that I booked for another 4 days on my return from sailing! A few Sydney tips: Don't catch the Sydney Explorer - it's alot more interesting to do it on foot as you'll see alot more. Do catch the Bondi Explorer - get off at Watson's Bay for fish and chips, but watch the seagulls as they attack you! Get back on and hop off at Bondi Beach and do the coastal walk down to Coogee - its really beautiful. During your first day go up the Centrepoint Tower to get your bearings. Also, make a trip over to Balmain, hardly any tourists go there and it's full of gorgeous houses, boutiques and coffee shops, there's also a great view of Sydney. Finally, get the Lonely Planet book which just covers Sydney - it gives you some great walking tours so you really get to know the city.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading website and advertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in L'Otel for five nights in November 2002, but I am only writing a review now because I just returned to Sydney and had a chance to compare L'Otel to the Medusa, where I stayed more recently. Although in the same neighborhood, L'Otel is of a completely different (and lower) class than the Medusa. The room I was given was literally the smallest hotel room I have ever had -- and I have traveled quite extensively. The window opened into an airshaft, meaning the room had absolutely no natural light. Overall, the price point was acceptable for the truly minimal services and rather shabby decor, but I would never stay here again when there are so many other choices in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Alright place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a discounted rate on the internet for their larger rooms, which were not that large but has a balcony. The bathroom sits within the squarish room area, making the place look a bit squashed what with the double bed and glass table. The heavy bathroom swing door has no lock and doorway-catch so it slams really hard if u're not careful. Overall cleanliness was good but the hot water goes cold on u every now and then when u shower late at nite. The staff service the room every day, so it's nice to come back to a nice neat bed and fresh towels. The room comes with tv (with foxtel), fax and telephone, and hairdryer. I didn't see any ironing board though there was supposed to be one. No hotel facilities, thou their website is linked to a spa next door. You have to charge a $20 security deposit to your credit card when u check in, which is released when u check out. It's a short walk to the train station and just next to red-light district, location is fine if u want a convenient location but dunwanna pay to be right in the hustle and bustle of the city. However, i wldn't pay more than a discounted internet rate cos for a no-frills boutique hotel, i think it's pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not too bad. I got a good nightly rate for a last minute booking through ratestogo and was happy with what I received for the price paid. I stayed in the rear half of the hotel (some rooms are accessed via stairs after the entry hall/checkin desk, while others are accessed from a separate entrance on the next street over) in a top-floor room. Dragging suitcases up the narrow stairwell was a bit of a pain. The room itself was small but pleasant. The style was just as pictured on the website, however there is a little more wear and tear than is visible in the photos, particularly in the shower area. Earplugs come in handy here, as there is a fair amount of street noise. The neighbourhood is quite fun though, especially for 20-somethings, with plenty of cheap eats, internet cafes, and bars around. If you don't mind a bit of walking, it is a very pleasant ~20min walk into downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “I liked l'otel very much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very comfortable and nice minimalist designed hotel (all is white and soft) and very central, too. The welcoming is warm. l'otel, 114 darlinghust road 93606868. thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Very Good service”
Reviews.Author: C.G.Smith
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Sydney, my stay was the first week of spring. I read the previous comments after booking the hotel, and thought, oh ***, I have made a mistake. Got there, and after one night, realized I am either just easy or see things from a different angle. I had a junior room. It was small, with no view, but not as small as rooms I have paid twice the price for in Paris and San Francisco. The high ceilings gave it more volume too. The bed was very comfy (I'm 6'2") and I liked the "less is more" look of the place. It was a very busy weekend in Sydney, with football finals and all, so there was no vacancy for my 3rd night, and I went across town to stay elsewhere. However, I returned for 3 more nights to a different room. This one had a different layout, a window that opened in the bathroom, and a slightly larger shower, a glass desk, and a larger bed. Still very comfy, a little noisier, but not so that I couldn't sleep well. On the service side, the guys who worked there were very accomodating. I wanted ice, typical American that I am, and had a bucket of ice delivered to my room within 10 minutes. My partner called on my birthday, I was out, and one of the guys quickly made a birthday card with a sketch of the Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Opera House and my birthday message on it, and left it on the desk for me. I got great suggestions on good places to eat and drink and sight-see. All were done with kindness, and a casual earnestness, rather than the standard corporate line and painted on smile that I usually encounter in the hospitality industry. While the entry hall/front desk were one and the same, I thought it a clever use of a small amount of space. Location of the hotel is great--close to many bars, cafe's, pubs, stores, etc., but far enough away for some quiet. I have paid more money for blah, characterless hotels, with staff who didn't seem to care that I was spending my hard earned dollars to stay at their place of business, and this place was definitely not one of them. I would definitely recommend L'otel to my freinds and will stay again on my next time in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by the website!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Otel for (luckily) only one night in July, 2004. The hotel was cramped, shabby, and not at all how it looked on the website. Check-in was indeed a hallway, with a mild-mannered consierge and his mildly insulting cohort. Parking is a questionably-priced deal with the carwash down the street. Overall, the hotel and its arrangements made me nervous. However, the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and stinky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I have to agree with the other reviewers. Tiny room, dreadful noise coming from some pipe outside our window, no bar fridge, faulty airconditioner, no in-house movies as advertised (they have a deal with the video shop downstairs). The service was ok (smiles were present!). I don't know how they can justify the full room rate - I thought the web rate was ridiculous for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As per the other 2 reviews, we found this place appalling. We stayed there for 1 night only, out of a prospective 2 weeks, in November 2004. The website is a complete mis-representation, indicating a chic, modern hotel with a restaurant and bar, where the reality is a grubby, rundown and mildly threatening dump. The front desk is in a corridor and after checking-in, guests are invited to carry there bags up a series of dark stairwells to the room. Once therre, they will find a cramped, shabby space with next to no ammeneties. The whole experience is very dis-spiriting. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: pico74
Reviews.Content: Couldn't agree more with the first reviewer - except we didnt get to sleep till 5am - definitely the worst hotel I've stayed in for quite a while - we were planning on spending 3 nights but checkd out after 1 and the management and lastminute both refused to give us any form of refund.1 out of 5 is generous!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of prepaying for 5 nights at L'otel in January 2003. The experience left us with a bad taste in what is a beautiful city. We experience unhelpful, unfriendly staff with run down rooms (which no longer resemble those on the web site). As well as being located above a night club and therefore very hard to sleep anytime before 4am on weekends and only slightly earlier during the week. Many superior choices available in this great city.

HotelInfo.Name: L'Otel
HotelInfo.Address: 114 Darlinghurst Rd, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
